poem:
"A Lasting Farewell"

In a year of last things,
come celebrate the usual - sunset's sigh, a novel's closing line.
Ondaatje pens the quiet endings with a connoisseur's hand,
his atmosphere hanging like an au revoir.
Known more for narrative, he began a poet,
and in these last strains,
finds his first love still enduring,
lost and found between the lines.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "A Year of Last Things by Michael Ondaatje review – a connoisseur of atmospheres Michael Ondaatje has always been a poet – it is how he began his career 50 years ago – although he is more famous as a novelist and especially for his 1992 Booker prize-winning The English Patient (which also won the Golden Man Booker in 2018). In A Year of Last Things, he is writing about last – and lost –". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
